b.span:

20 Charger Lane Deering, MO 63840

p.span: Junior / Senior Prom has been rescheduled for June 12th.

p.strong: FOLLOW US ON FACEBOOK: DELTA C-7 SCHOOLS

p.style: margin-top:3.75pt;margin-right:3.75pt;margin-bottom: 1.5pt;margin-left:3.0pt; font-family: 'Bookman Old Style'; font-size: x-large; color: #0000FF; font-weight: bold;

td.p: Graduation is set for Friday, June 19th at 7pm in the gym.

p.style: margin-top:3.75pt;margin-right:3.75pt;margin-bottom: 1.5pt;margin-left:3.0pt; font-family: 'Bookman Old Style'; font-size: x-large; color: #0000FF; font-weight: bold;

td.p: If we are unable to have it then, it will be Friday, July 10th at 7pm.

p.span: Due to the Governor's order, all Missouri schools will remain closed through the end of the academic year. All extracurricular activities will remain suspended until further notice.

td.p: We encourage parents, staff and students to follow the guidance of the Center for Disease Control (CDC).

span.span: Stay away from the elderly and those with compromised immune symptoms.

td.p: Any additional information will be provided through school Facebook pages, local media, school messenger, and/or on this site.

strong.span: ATTENTION PARENTS/GUARDIANS: Per the handbook, please make your childs after school transportation arrangements BEFORE sending your child to school. We understand that occasionally emergency situations happen and you need to call and make changes. However, we are receiving a lot of phone calls daily that are not of an emergency nature. We greatly appreciate your help with this matter as it will result in less interruptions to the classroom.

i.span: Parents/Guardians: If you have changed your phone number or address, please contact the school office as soon as possible. We need current numbers on file in case of emergencies.

strong.span: School sign constructed of bricks from the former 2-story building.

span.span: Please click here for important letter concerning new safety procedures at Delta C-7.

i.span: If anyone is interested in participating in the development, review, update, and implementation of the Local School Wellness Policy, contact the Superintendents office at 573-757-6648. Also, a

span.i: copy of the Local School Wellness Policy may be obtained by request as well as

i.span: the results of the most recent assessment on the implementation of the Local School Wellness by contacting the Superintendents office at 573-757-6648.

img.span: Welcome to Delta C-7 School District. It is our desire to provide the best education possible for every student. In order to achieve that goal, there must be a sense of cooperation among students, faculty, administration, school board, and the community. We encourage parents to take an active interest in all aspects of their childs education. We also encourage students to involve their parents/guardians in their educational endeavors. We are proud of our school. We have outstanding traditions, and intend to continually build on those traditions. Lets make our effort a cooperative one that will allow us to provide the best we can for our students!

As parents, educators, alumni and members of the community we have an interest in the quality of our schools and the performance of our students. Delta C-7 School System is vitally interested in the quality of all areas of education. The various instructional programs offered by the district will be developed with the view toward maintaining a balanced and sequential curriculum that will serve the educational needs of all school-aged children in the district. The curriculum will also meet requirements established by state law, the Missouri State Board of Education and/or the Missouri Department of Elementary and Secondary Education. Local school efforts have been directed toward improving methods in administration and instruction, with emphasis on providing in-service education, workshops, and developing guidelines for the successful operation of the school.

p.span: The educational program of the Delta C-7 School District will provide for both formal studies to meet the general academic needs of students, as well as opportunities for individual students to develop specific talents and interests in the performing arts, practical arts, vocational-technical education and other specialized fields.
